Why a South Island tractor driver’s chance moa discovery just got more incredible https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/why-a-south-island-tractor-drivers-chance-moa-discovery-just-got-more-incredible/RF6CQY5ARFFEHMU2VQHTLUG6AE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/why-a-south-island-tractor-drivers-chance-moa-discovery-just-got-more-incredible/RF6CQY5ARFFEHMU2VQHTLUG6AE/ Jamie MortonMoa footprints discovered in Otago riverbed found to be second-oldest ever documented. Wed, 15 Nov 2023 04:00:00 +0000 In 2019, Ranfurly man Michael Johnston found, in the Kyeburn River, what turned out to be the South Island's first fossilised moa footprints. Now, scientists have dated them at more than three million years old - making them the second-oldest ever documented. Photo / Stephen Jaquiery
